result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rebecca L Smith

records.addlTxt: 9:55 AM Defendant Rebecca L Smith in court.  Attorney Georgia L. Konstantakis in court for Rebecca L Smith.  Prosecuting attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott in court for the State of Wisconsin. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski.  The State has tendered a global offer.  Blood results are back on 22CF140.  Blood results are not back on 21CF697. The State is not sure if there was blood taken on one case and will follow up.  State files an amended complaint on case 22CF140.  Parties will continue to negotiate.  All Motions in Limine, Witness lists, Proposed Jury Instructions and changes to the Substantive Jury Instructions are due 48  hours before the December 5, 2022 Jury Status and Final Pretrial.  Parties are to check for witness availability for this scheduled trial date and inform the Court of any problems.  If the parties come to an agreement, they may email the clerk and get a plea/sent date.
Character letter

Status conference on June 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:40 AM Prosecuting attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Rebecca L Smith in court.  Attorney Georgia L. Konstantakis in court for Rebecca L Smith. Court Reporter:  Carmen Howard.  A global offer has been extended in February.  Defense is still waiting on blood results.  Defense has reviewed the global offer with the deft.  The State makes comment regarding the results.  The State will follow up once again with the lab this week.  Defense would be requesting another status on all files.  Defense has submitted a motion to modify the bond.   Defense makes further argument.  Defense indicates that Family court will not give any orders unless the bond is changed in felony court.  The court comments.  These issues should be handled in Family Court.  There needs to be a legal separation or a divorce filing in order to get this issue started.  Defendant makes comment.  Defense is asking the court to amend the bond to allow the defendant to see the children.  The State objects to any modification with argument.  Defense responds.  BTC: For the reasons the court has given on the record, bond modification is denied.  These issues should be handled in Family Court.  This court will concede to any Family Court orders put into effect.
Status conference scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.
atty Kostantakis
DA Autho to Def re Electronic Evidence

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
NG plea entered.
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.

9:38 AM Prosecuting attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Rebecca L Smith appeared in court, Plaintiff State of Wisconsin appeared in court. Court reporter Linda Matoska. Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set. 
BTC: Atty Konstantakis appointed on cases 22CF188 and 22CF140, repayment of $25/month beginning on May 2, 2022.  
State defers to the court on bond.  Defense asks for a signature bond on the new files.
Defense asks for the previous bonds to be modified.  State does not have Marcy's Law compliance.  Defense will file a motion and asks for a bond hearing date.
Status conference scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on April 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
